x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement: Children today face increasing emotional overload, anxiety, and unhealthy screen habits. Adults, have many wellbeing apps. Most digital spaces for children are entertainment-driven, feeding on addictive tendencies and not driven by need for instantaneous gratification. Parents and teachers recognize signs of stress or disengagement but are powerless against the pull of bright lights, fast rewards, and make-believe worlds. Children lack a safe, engaging way to express their feelings or build daily emotional resilience and balance.

How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

Solution Proposal

Value Proposition

Ripple Mind transforms emotional wellbeing into a joyful daily habit for children aged 7–15.
It combines gamification, storytelling, and gentle AI nudges to make mindfulness, gratitude, and kindness as engaging as screen time.
Children check in on their feelings, complete short wellbeing or movement activities, and earn badges for healthy routines — building emotional awareness and resilience.
For parents and teachers, Ripple Mind provides insight and conversation prompts — not surveillance — enabling early support and positive reinforcement.
By making wellbeing interactive and rewarding, Ripple Mind nurtures healthier digital habits and emotional intelligence from an early age.

Vision

Ripple Mind envisions a world where children see self-care as exciting, natural, and part of their daily rhythm.
It empowers them to understand emotions, express themselves safely, and practice kindness — both online and offline.
The platform brings together families, schools, and communities around a shared goal: nurturing mental wellness through meaningful, tech-enabled connections.
Over time, Ripple Mind aims to create measurable impact — reducing anxiety, boosting confidence, and spreading the habit of positive self-reflection, one ripple at a time.

Which ServiceNow Products or Capabilities Would Be Used

Integrations

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

  • Integration with safe video or educational content APIs.
  • Secure authentication with parental consent management.
  • Notification services for activity reminders (push, email, or SMS).
  • Optional AI/ML services for mood-based content personalization.

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

  • Maintaining privacy and safeguarding child data.
  • Ensuring content remains inclusive and age-appropriate.
  • Encouraging consistent engagement without overuse.
  • Partnering with schools and parents for co-adoption and trust.
